name: The Pacific Northwest House near Salem, OR
description:
The Pacific Northwest House is nestled in a rural suburb southeast of the city of Salem, Oregon. Perfect for traveling for work or leisure to the Salem area, or the surrounding towns of Silverton, Stayton and Sublimity. A few miles from the Interstate 5 makes travel north to Portland or south to Eugene areas a breeze. The house sits on a dead-end street, and backs up to a small private lake (Willa Lake) co-owned by the hosts and surrounding neighbors.

The space
The Pacific Northwest house has been newly updated with vacationers in mind. There are three bedrooms (master: queen bed, 2nd bedroom: queen bed and crib, 3rd bedroom: two twin beds), a large living room, two full bathrooms (one in the master suite). The full kitchen will delight chefs with an array of cooking and baking dishes and utensils - perfect for those family dinners while you vacation. A large covered patio looks out over the lake and is furnished with leisure and relaxation as the plan. Do
neighborhood_overview: The PNW House is set on a dead-end street in a rural neighborhood.  Most of the neighbors on this street are long-time homeowners of their property, and strive to keep it a quiet, family-friendly place.  We are outside the city limits of Salem a couple of miles.
host_about:
Tiffany is a mother of two boys who's real name is "Hey, Mom".  Trying to manage the long comedy sketch (humor is simply a survival skill at this point) that is a household which includes two active kids is what fills her days.  Some days that includes hiding in the closet from them after sneaking the chocolate from their Halloween baskets.  Truth.  This gig is not for the faint of heart.   

Mike is a man on a mission.  Nearing retiring age, he is counting down the days for when "all in a day's work" equates hitching up the boat and heading to a lake for a little jig pitchin' and tube flippin'.  Bass fishing is in this man's blood.  It's a love he's doing his best to instill in his boy's upbringing as well.

Met and married in the early 2000's, we have recently returned to our roots, so to speak, and have ditched the city life of our 20's and 30's for country living.  We are in a season of parenthood in our lives, and a simple but well-rounded existence is what we crave, with room to roam for our children to grow up exploring.  We are blessed to live where we do, and feel we can share a little piece of our private everyday getaway with you through offering our short term rental options on Airbnb!

We have a twin size roll-away bed available. This can be used for that extra perso

This is the perfect place for a traveling nurse with the Salem hospital or month to month starts.
This is a daylight basement studio in a quiet neighborhood in s. salem, only 2 miles from downtown. This is a nice unit for one to 2 people for long stay or a tighter stay for group of 4 persons. name: Englewood Loft
description:
Welcome to the heart of Salem! This studio apartment is located above our home, just outside the historic district of Salem's downtown. Step outside and explore until you drop, or stay in to rest.

The space
Upstairs studio with private entrance. Single parking space off road available. Keyless entry for easy check in. This quirky Englewood Loft studio-style rental is fully equipped with all the comforts of home. Hiking and waterfalls are as near as the next town over, the coast is a little more than an hour away, and skiing in the winter is just over the mountain pass.

Relaxation is our specialty. We are pros at chilling and taking it easy and chances are you deserve it. Furnished with a memory foam queen-size bed, this well decorated loft will be a much appreciated treat after a day of walking our great hiking trails. A full bathroom and kitchen packed with all the comforts of home. Hang out and watch a large flat screen TV, with a Roku to connect
neighborhood_overview: The loft is situated in the historic Englewood Neighborhood. Walking distance to Englewood Park with walking trail, and only a 5 minute drive to downtown. Close to the Oregon State Capitol, fairgrounds, Willamette University, Salem Health Hospital, Oregon State Hospital, Chemeketa Community College, and Corban University.
host_about: I love hot tea, hiking, plants, and crafting!

name: Liberty Acre
description:
Come enjoy nature, fresh air, and an adjustable Tempur-Pedic bed. Sip on your complimentary wine, and nibble on some chocolate from your private patio.

There are 4 wineries within ten minutes of the house, if you would like a designated driver that can be arranged for a small fee.

Close to Detroit Lake, Spirit Mountain Casino, & Lincoln City! Tons of hiking and parks are near by as well.

Bring your fur babies too!

The space
The property sits on an acre. The back half is fully fenced in with plenty of room for fur babies and their humans to stretch their legs. The property does have a septic and well, so the pipes are sensitive to items such as baby wipes, feminine hygiene products, q-tips etc. (please use the trash can for items such as these). The master suite is located on the upper level of the home and has a private deck and your own bathroom/ and shower amenities are included. There is a 4k TV located in your bedroom, so ma
neighborhood_overview: Quiet and Peaceful, close to the highway and wineries. Will need a vehicle to get to town and grocery stores since we are in a rural area. The closest grocery store is 7 minutes away.
host_about: HI, my name is Stephanie & my co-host is Tami. We joined Airbnb to share the beautiful North West & all it has to offer with those that are coming through town. Take a post card, drink some complimentary wine, enjoy nature and sleep soundly.

name: LARGE Upstairs 2 Bed 2 Bath condo Creek View!
description:
With the creek view, you feel like you are camping but with the convenience of being in the City Center. 2nd floor unit with 1 set of stairs to access the unit. Private unit at end of building (only one neighbor)

You will have one assigned parking spot and a second spot may be available upon request.

The space
Over 1000 SF! Sunny and bright two bedrooms, two bathrooms, full kitchen, large living room, Creekside condo just blocks from downtown Salem. Wonderful view of historic Mill Creek and large balcony overlooking the creek. Reserved parking . Three blocks from Salem Center Mall, five blocks from State Capital and six from Willamette University. This is in an apartment building, it is on the second floor so you will have a neighbor below and to the side of you. You will hear other people which is part of life when sharing walls. If that is not something you want please look for a home that would better suit you. Thanks for understanding!
neighborhood_overview:
Check out the guidebook section of this site, we have a lot of fun things to do, see and eat!

You are in the downtown area and though it is very safe (the new police station is being built only 4 blocks away), this is a metro area and there are two homeless support facilities in the downtown area so you will see the people they support. We have never had any issues or any of our guests, but it is a part of life in many cities and you should be aware of it.
host_about: Love to travel and spend time with my family and our dog!  Grew up in Oregon and loved coming back after college.

The space
I love using AirBnB for local and international travel.

HOWEVER... I get frustrated when the basic stuff is missing from a place; so, I know exactly the things you want too:

- CLEAN (This is the golden rule, not to be broken)
- High Speed WiFi
- Smart TV + Netflix (you can sign into any other account you have, Amazon Prime, Hulu, etc.)
- Lots of natural light + well lit at night
- Q
neighborhood_overview:
I love my neighborhood because it is so close to everything you need. It is walking distance from Five Guys, Taco Bell, McDonalds, Pietro's Pizza, and many others.

The Willamette Town Center Mall with Regal Theater, Best Buy, Hobby Lobby and Red Robbins are all a few short minutes drive away.

It is a quick drive right downtown. Where you have riverfront park. I really enjoy grabbing a drink at Isaac's Coffee, Gov Cup or Broadway Coffee and going for a stroll. Broadway has a fireplace and amazing outdoor seating.

I love renting bikes with Zagster ($3 an hour!!!) and biking from downtown, through river front park, across the bike bridge into Minto Brown Island park. Worth it!

How far away is your AirBnB from...

- Salem Hospital, 3.2 miles
- Riverfront Park, 3.2 miles
- Market st. i5 exit, .5 miles
- Downtown, 2.8 miles
- Taco Bell, .5 miles
- Walgreens, .6 miles
- Bush Park, 3.3 miles
host_about:
I have traveled to 17 countries: Spain, England, Nepal, Thailand, Cambodia, Singapore, Mexico, Canada, Honduras, Costa Rica and Nicaragua. Oh and Scotland, South Africa, Mozambique, Oman and UAE. 

I love experiencing new things and meeting new people of the world. I learned Spanish when I lived in Mexico.

Lately I have been getting into loose leaf green tea.
Podcasts: Reply All, Heavy Weight, Another Kingdom (fiction)
TV: The Good Place, Schitt's Creek, The Office (forever and ever)


**Please give me your travel recommendations, I always appreciate tips.

description:

Our townhouse is open, bright & clean with comfy furniture and big beds upstairs. The kitchen is stocked with the basics including spices and oil to get you started. Kitchen table seats 6 or have dinner outside on the patio. It's set up for both! Sleeps 6 people Max 2 vehicles per city code, no animals, smoking, vaping or mj.

The space
Our townhome sits on a simple street on a beautifully landscaped lot and offers guests a quiet and restful stay. With all 3 bedrooms and a full bathroom upstairs, there is a great separation of space and places for everyone to spread out. The main level has the wide open spaces of the living room, dining room and kitchen. The living room has comfy seating and a wall mounted flat screen tv and 220+
channels to choose from! The kitchen has all the appliances needed t

Our neighbors include a friendly neighbor in a house next door and a commercial company on the other side.  It is usually very quiet as few cars use our street.
host_about: I am retired. Also a master gardener and love to bake. I am a wife, mother and Grandmother, and love every minute of it.

name: 1950's Charm-Great for long/short term. Come stay!
description:
Great area in Salem! Minutes from downtown, quiet street, walk to Bush park, very comfortable neighborhood. This 1950's house has 2 bedrooms with ample closet space, an office with door to the backyard and deck, spacious living room with a cozy gas fireplace, smart TV, garage with washer and dryer accessed through the kitchen, gas stove and many other amenities. The house is easy to get to from I5, about an hour from Portland. Perfect for a 1-2 couples or a small family. Most everything is new!

The space
You will have the whole house to yourself! There are 2 bedrooms, one with a queen bed and the other with a full size bed. There are dressers and closets with wood hangers in each. Both rooms have night stands with lamps and nightlights. Extra bedding can be found in the closets or the linen closet in the hall.

The office has a generous desk and chair, sitting area and a door to the backyard deck. I love the sunlight this room gets. The office closet h
neighborhood_overview:
The house is 5 minutes from Willamette University, 6 minutes to the Capital building, downtown Salem and Salem Hospital.

Bush's Pasture park is about a 15 minute very pleasant walk from the house. Minto-Brown Island Park is about 10 minutes drive away.

The stunning Oregon coast is about an hour and 15 minutes away and is a must see if you have never been.

Mt Hood skiing, snowboarding and winter activities are about 2 hours away. This area is also beautiful in the summer.

The house is about 55 minutes from downtown Portland where you can find all the big city attractions.

Here is a link to some local Salem sights:

https://link.oregonlive.com/view/5e8c7cf20bbeac2af433d63aeazfc.1fm/4f30e394
host_about:
I love to travel, most recently I went on a 2 week  cruise through the Panama Canal, Central America and just touching South America, and Prior to that I spent September in the Greek Isles. I have been to Hungary, England, Germany,  Scotland and Italy recently, but have also been to Thailand, Costa Rica, Ireland, Belgium, Spain, New Zealand, Mexico, Portugal, Canada and more. During the warmer months I like to get on the river kayaking-flat water and garden. My house is full of books which you are welcome to. I like tea, rocks, playing pool, spicy food, getting together with family and friends. Laughter is important to me. 
I am an RN. I eat a vegetarian diet but have no problem if you do not.
I grew up in Portland, lived away for 7 years and returned when I started my family. I raised my 3 daughters essentially on my own with a little help from my folks and siblings. They are grown now-my oldest living in Alaska, the other 2 in Oregon- the youngest is only a couple miles away. 
I am often away from home for several hours to days or more but can check my email and phone usually.
 Smoking is OK on the back patio and front porch if desired, away from open doors and windows. The Portland metro area has much to offer and I like to get out for the experience. I am open but know how to give people their space. Feel free to ask me anything. 
I enjoy helping people, fun, new faces and places. I like games and friendly competition, movies and the feel of a good book in my hands. I've lately started watching some shows on HBO, Netflix and Hulu after a long hiatus from TV. I have a soft spot for sci-fi and fantasy-don't judge! Traveling is important to me.
My daughter comes to visit sometimes with her old Min Pin named Bella who is very sweet and quite blind. An old bike available upon request though the tires may need air.

name: Private entry, beautiful farmhouse vibe and quiet
description:
Amazing popular Airbnb nightly rental, one of a kind. More than a room/suite, it’s an adventure!
Whether your visiting family/friends or working in the area, you’ll love my private daylight basement w/queen bed, private bathroom and entrance. French doors open into the backyard. Driveway parking. New 50 inch Flat screen TV with Hulu and Netflix.
Near Minto Brown, 3.2 miles to Salem Hospital, and close to Downtown Salem, state buildings and Willamette U. 1 hour drive to Portland.

The space
A farmhouse vibe in a great safe neighborhood. There is plenty of room to stretch out and settle in for the night. Long term guests are welcome to enjoy my gourmet kitchen with 2 ovens and gas stove. Kitchen is well stocked with pots and pans. Washer and dryer avail on request.

Guest access
Hassle free check in. Guests will park in the driveway. Short easy walk to the private entrance of daylight basement and the walkway is well lit at night.

Desirable area in S Salem. Beautiful homes in a safe neighborhood.
Near Minto Brown Park, Salem Hospital and downtown Salem. 45-60 minutes to Portland. Lots of places to go hiking.

name: Willamette River Guesthouse
description:
The mighty Willamette River is one of the few rivers in the world that flows north. From the comfort of our 1300 sq/ft guesthouse, visitors will enjoy a front row view of the river and all of its offerings….serene sunsets, birdwatching, wildlife, and more.

The Willamette Valley is wine country! Several wineries in the immediate area, and beyond, to explore.

With convenient access to I5, you are only one hour to Portland or the coast, and about 2.5 hours to Mt. Hood -perfect day trip!

The space
Light continental-style breakfast included at this cozy retreat on the Willamette River. The master bedroom offers a newly remodeled ensuite bathroom with dual shower heads & a bluetooth speaker/light/fan. Memory Fiber cooling pillows for both beds and a memory foam mattress topper in the second bedroom. Stackable laundry unit in the hall between the master and the second bathroom. Large windows give you plenty of natural light and river views from t
neighborhood_overview: If you can peel yourself away from the river, you will find a very active walking/jogging/bicycle friendly neighborhood with multiple parks and a Little Free Library to discover along the way.  Be sure to check out Sunset Park, which takes you right up to the waters edge!
host_about:
Hello Fellow Adventurers!

My husband and I are professionals, and, recent Empty-Nesters. We love family, food, good conversation, and fair-weather outdoor activities (wink). We moved to the PNW, from the Bay Area, 20 years ago and enjoy travel as much as we enjoy a cozy night-in at home. Always trying to be more intentional with this one life we have to live.

"One day, or, day one - you decide.”   ~author unknown

name: 1000 sq ft Studio apartment. Washer/dryer. Parking
description:
The Grace House Guest suite with private entrance and off street parking. Conveniently located close to Capitol, University, Hospital, Convention Center, Fairgrounds and I-5. Situated in a quiet historical neighborhood with beautiful trees and architecture. Perfect for traveling healthcare workers and legislators. You have access to the entire 1000 sq ft space which includes a Ca King bed, full size sleeper sofa, kitchenette, bathroom, washer/dryer, and a great garden patio seating area.

The space
Over 1000 sq ft of relaxed living in this 1928 Tudor guest suite. You're only a few blocks away from the farmers market, state capitol, riverfront park, and downtown. You're also conveniently location close to I-5 and 99W. The space features a roomy cal king bed, full size memory foam sleeper sofa, electric fireplace for added warmth and ambiance, full size washer & dryer, shower, brass wet bar with kitchenette, fridge, ice maker, microwave, toaster and induction
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is fairly quiet and older. Most homes were build in the 1920's - 1930's. There are some beautiful homes in the area and it's quite lovely to take a morning walk. It's a short walk to the farmers market. Joe Mocha is a great cafe a block away which sells coffee and breakfast/lunch items. There are also two convenience stores and a local bar within walking distance. Downtown is a short stroll and is a great opportunity to see the many cherry blossom trees Salem is so well known for. The downtown restaurants are vibrant with excellent food and craft cocktails. Down on the waterfront, you'll find a fantastic park, a beautiful bridge and our famous carousel. Lots of great activities can be found very close by.

Nearby parks: Minto Brown, Bush Pasture, Riverfront

If you're looking for great wine, food or activity recommendations, I'm happy to assit as I have great relationships with many in the area and know they will take amazing care of you!

name: The Garden Flat at Botaneity, Oregon wine country
description:
Inspired by the quaint apartments we've visited in Paris, our charming, private garden flat in the Willamette Valley is surrounded by 30+ wineries and is a 5 minute drive to downtown restaurants & shops, the riverwalk and Willamette University. Take a day trip to the coast or relax & enjoy a bottle of wine from our list curated by your host, a local winemaker! Our c.1870 farmhouse welcomes you with a private entrance & features exposed brick, kitchenette, & environmentally-conscious amenities.

The space
Your hosts, a local winemaker and a local artist, invite you to relax in Oregon wine country. Our thoughtful amenities include: wine list curated by your host, organic Avocado mattress topper, vegan Aveda shower products, and more. The space also features a gallery wall with rotating local artists and art available for purchase.

You're invited to join us seasonally at our on-site farmstand for hot coffee, fresh baked goods & gifts.

"Garden
neighborhood_overview:
• Wineries in every direction!
• Walk to the park - 0.2 miles down the street!
• Downtown Salem - 2 miles
• The coast - 1 hour
• McMinnville - 20 minutes
• Portland - 1 hour
host_about: Bonjour! We are Kayla & Robert Lauer, a creative couple living in Salem, Oregon with our dog Sam. Robert is a local winemaker, making wine for Stangeland and our label, Botaneity. Kayla is a graphic designer and interior decorator. Both of us have a love for travel, wine and food.

name: Houck Hollow
description:
This custom-built home designed by New York Times Bestselling Author, Colleen Houck, is set up as a family reunion retreat. It features two kitchens, themed rooms for sleeping and gathering, a media room with surround sound, and a game room. The outdoors include multiple fairy gardens, a seasonal pond, a large vegetable garden, a koi pond, and much more! With plenty of indoor and outdoor games and activities including a kid's map and scavenger hunt, you'll want to return again and again.

The space
With more than nine acres to explore at Houck Hollow, guests will be entranced with the outdoor amenities, which include ponds and fairy gardens. There are more than twenty trees with unique green men's faces to discover on the scavenger hunt. A beautiful creek cuts through the entire property and you won't want to miss the seasonal lake that springs up behind the house in the winter months. With plenty of outdoor seating beneath a covered porch, you'll enjoy watching t
neighborhood_overview: Houck Hollow sits on the outskirts of Salem, the capital of Oregon. The downtown area is full of fun shops and quirky dining opportunities, including The Coin Jam, an old-school arcade and restaurant, and one of Colleen's favorite stops, The Book Bin. If you're willing to drive a little, you aren't far from Silver Falls, and the beach at Lincoln City! There are frequently open-air markets and festivals to make your stay even more exciting.

description:
This lovely, private retreat awaits you in Salem, near the shores of the Willamette River! Fitted with 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a fully equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances, and a wood-burning fire pit for marshmallow roasting, this house is a great escape. Explore Salem's amazing food culture, relax at Riverfront City Park, tour Hallie Ford Museum of Art, or escape to Enchanted Forest for a fun-filled family day. This vacation rental is an ideal home base for your Oregon adventures!

The space
1,431 Sq Ft | Nearby Shops, Restaurants, & Breweries | <2 Miles to Riverfront City Park & Salem Center Shopping Mall

Privacy and convenience are key at this charming vacation home, located only a short drive from all of Salem’s amazing attractions and sightseeing opportunities!

Bedroom 1: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Full Bed, Twin Futon | Bedroom 3: Full Bed | Living Room: Sleeper Sofa

OUTDOOR LIVING: Fenced yard, patio, gas grill, fi

LOCAL ATTRACTIONS: Salem's Riverfront Carousel (1.8 miles), Gilbert House Children's Museum (1.9 miles), Hallie Ford Museum of Art (2.2 miles), Willamette University (2.6 miles), Deepwood Museum & Gardens (3.1 miles), Get Air Trampoline Park (5.9 miles), Enchanted Forest (11.5 miles)
EAT & DRINK: Annette's Westgate (0.4 miles), Walery's Premium Pizza (0.4 miles), Nancy Jo's Burgers and Fries (0.4 miles), Momiji Sushi West Salem (0.5 miles), Xicha Brewing Co. (0.5 miles), Azuls Taco House (0.6 miles), Garibaldi (0.6 miles)
AIRPORT: Portland International Airport (59.1 miles)

name: Pacific High Point - 1 BR 1 BA Private w/ Views
description:
Nestled in the heart of the Willamette Valley, surrounded by Oregon's scenic wine country, this clean and private guest suite has gorgeous views from the bedroom, living room, and private deck. Surrounded by mature trees and many friendly forest critters, a setting that any nature lover will appreciate. Easy access to and from the freeway makes it convenient to get around and is centrally located to so many points of interest. Free designated parking space on premises with extra room if needed.

The space
Located on nearly 1.5 acres of forested land surrounded by mature trees, wildlife, and natural beauty. Feels like you are out of the hustle and bustle, but still only a 10 minute drive to the grocery store. Hosts live on main level of home and the private guest suite is located downstairs in a daylight basement. Although it feels like anything but a basement, with bright, big windows and 9 foot ceilings. To access the guest suite, guests will use the side entranc
neighborhood_overview: Located on a paved, private drive with mature trees. Very peaceful and quiet space.
host_about: Hi! I’m Kinsey! I was born and raised in Utah and graduated from the University of Utah in 2009 with my Bachelor’s in English. I married the love of my life, John, later that year and we’ve been inseparable ever since. We enjoy traveling when we can, cooking, checking out new restaurants and local vineyards, hiking, driving out to the Coast, and just simply spending time together. After 2020 happened, John was able to work remotely, we discovered that we were both eager for a change of scenery and a new chapter in our life story. We took a trip up here and were instantly drawn by the overwhelming natural beauty of the PNW and have absolutely fallen head over heels. In April of 2021, our dream of a new chapter became reality and we moved, along with our two furbabies, up here to Oregon. There is so much to see and explore here and it’s truly a nature lover’s paradise. We are thrilled to have the opportunity to be able to share our little slice of heaven!

name: Security System | Work Space | Long Stays | W/D
description:
♡ Save and Share, Keep an Eye on it ♡

This two story Town house features 2 bedrooms and 1.5 bathrooms, fast wifi (700Mbps+) and is located in a peaceful community along side a small rippling brook.

In a quiet neighborhood off of Commercial, just south of Downtown, it is within a 5 minute drive of food, groceries, entertainment, shops, parks and much more.

This is an ideal space for those who are looking to stay 30 days or more, be it traveling, relocating, remodeling or for work.

The space
This space has a cozy and relaxing atmosphere that is perfect to unwind in. Having a small green space, brook and large oak tree out back acts as a private oasis in the city.

Either to work or relax, we have you covered:

➢ Keyless Entry tied to a Security System
➢ Fast Wi-Fi (700Mbps+)
➢ Dedicated Work Area
➢ Charging Stations
➢ Patio next to the brook
➢ 55" & 43" 4K Roku TV w/ Netflix & Youtu

WHERE’S WALDO WOOD CABIN
The address is 720 Waldo Ave SE Salem Oregon it is not on Tillman ave!

The space
The Waldo Wood Cabin is barn red on the outside and a little wood gem on the inside.If you have an electric car, we have a charger for easy charging. This little wood cabin is located approximately 2.5 miles from downtown Salem. No need though to get on a busy street, just mosey down High Street past tree-lined vintage homes. High Street will take you downtown. The backyard is totally fenced in and there is a huge evergreen tree that creates great shade in the summer.If you want to stay within close walking distance, maybe you don’t have a car, try Venti’s, The French Press, ACME, for restaurants, Roths and LIfe Source for groceries, and Aunt Bee’s House for vintage finds. Bush Park is close for a run or walk. Once you walk up to High Street there are sidewalks everywhere, making it a great

It’s the perfect house for getting ready to get married, for honeymooning, for a professional who needs a quiet sanctuary, or as a base camp to explore the Pacific NorthWest. Portland is a little over an hour away as is the Pacific Ocean. Hike Silver Falls, or take the Amtrak train which has a station within 2 miles and has free parking. Go to Bend or Seattle  for a day or two and then come back to your Salem base camp.

name: Century House Maple Room bright and spacious
description:
The Maple Room is spacious and bright, and on the back side of the house, with lots of trees. One step away from a totally refurbished bathroom. The Maple Room has its own heating and cooling unit. Across the hall is a sitting/play/reading/eating space, with adjacent kitchenette. Kitchenette has full fridge, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, rice cooker, crockpot, and induction cooktop/pans. The refrigerator will be well stocked with a significant morning "snack" of fruit, pastry, protein.

The space
There's a mini forest out back, with delightful shade, Adirondacks, a fire pit, a very special swing, and a napping house!
neighborhood_overview: So much to see within a mile from Century House: the state Capitol,  Willamette University, Bush Park and rose garden, historic museums, restaurants, shopping, and the Willamette River!
host_about:
Bicycling is my passion and my past-time, as well as my recipe for physical and emotional well-being.  Most recently, I have enjoyed “packing down” my bike with gear and heading down the road - for an overnight, or three, or three weeks.  This gives a whole new meaning to “bed and breakfast”.

When I’m not cycling, I’m usually busy cooking, cleaning, reading, sewing or watching the trees and flowers grow in my little forest; and, of course, accommodating the many fascinating guests who find their way to Century House from all corners of the globe.  My life is truly enriched by the diversity of perspectives and experiences that guests bring with them.

I confess, my favorite guests may be the children. With a full career of working in the field of early childhood, I never cease to be wowed by the uninhibited enthusiasm, curiosity, and resilience of the younger generation.  I am thrilled and dedicated to being a family-friendly business.

Another of my endeavors is the promotion/education of good nutrition.  I might be seen pedaling to a local farm to fill my packs with broccoli for the local food bank  - or, with fresh kale for a morning smoothie :-).  Don’t worry, there is still room for a brownie or an oatmeal cookie on the dessert tray.  After all, we need our dark chocolate, and our oatmeal, right?

name: Birchwood Glen Townhome, Hosted by Salemstays.com
description:
20th century townhouse within walking distance to downtown Salem and Willamette University. The Birchwood Glen Townhome is delightfully appointed with historical distinction. Hardwood floors and arched doorways add to its cozy charm. City center is just down the street and the grocery store is around the corner, with a nice private back patio for you to relax under our birchwood glen. You'll have the entire 2 bedroom, full bath home to yourself for your comfort and relaxation.

The space
Neighborhood overview
Northeast Neighbors (NEN) encompasses a beautiful historic part of Salem, including the Court-Chemeketa Historic District, which is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. The neighborhood is roughly bordered by State Street to the south, the Oregon State Fair property to the north, the Union Pacific railroad to the west with a slight jog westerly around Parrish Middle School and the surrounding neighborhood and 24th Avenue NE to the east.

name: Near I5: Spacious tent & cots with outdoor seating
description:
We wanted to host the kind of space we like when we travel: affordable, simple, safe, kid-friendly, and pet-friendly.

Our spacious Coleman tent is set up with cots, a table, lamp, and flashlights for two people, but you can scale up and add more adults, children, or friendly pets. There are two comfortable outdoor seating areas. You will have access to a bathroom designated for your use, though it is accessible through the house - meaning our kids and beagle may greet you.

Welcome, traveler!

The space
Think of this as a convenient camping experience: you have a site but it's not remote, you have a tent but don't have to fuss with setting it up, and you have access to a bathroom but there are no giant mosquitos lurking inside. It's a simple, clean stay in a tent.

The tent price includes cots & tent linens for two adults. The adult sized cot measures 75" long, 35" wide, and 17" tall. You can add up to two spaces at an increased nigh

host_about:
Hello! We are a book, lego, art, and food-loving family of four: Stephanie, James, Oliver, & Lincoln. Well, we are five when at home with our four-legged family member, Otis. :) 

We fancy ourselves growing travelers and took a break from travel in 2020, but we came back strong with a 33-day road trip in 2021 and a 37-day road trip in 2022. We have experienced 20 national parks together!

Traveling with kids has really changed our desire to have and offer options for affordable and safe travel. We used to travel and host on CouchSurfing, but we are looking to expand our travels with Airbnb for more family-centered travel experiences.

description:
The Vineyard House is nestled amongst a half century Pinot Noir Vineyard in the heart of the Willamette Valley. The 600 SF structure is brand new construction and contains everything a would be traveler(s) or a remote worker would need. The finishes are all of premium quality and the privacy and quietness of the vineyard are sure to not disappoint.

The space
Your own private vineyard stay.

Other things to note
It’s like National Geographic in the vineyard. Watch out above for the hawks, great blue heron “blue”, and bare witness to all of the fascinating nature and wild life of this localized eco system.

name: Willamette Valley wine country - close to Eugene
description:
Stroll .5 mile through our tranquil neighborhood to one of the 25 tasting rooms for which the Willamette Valley is known. A short 7 min drive and you’ll be in downtown Salem which hosts amazing coffee shops and restaurants. Bike, walk or run along our beautiful downtown riverfront which hosts over 10 miles of continuous walking paths. We have all the amenities you'll need to enjoy and feel at home. Ideal location for Ironman ‘22 or the World Athletics Championships - just 1.25 hours to Eugene.

The space
A cozy great room and a fully stocked kitchen will make coming home after a day of exploring something you look forward to. Enjoy a glass of wine overlooking the neighboring farmlands, or just relax and enjoy your company.

Three spacious bedrooms and 4th bedroom/office that includes a pull out bed, you'll have plenty of space to rest up for your next day of exploring.

Guest access
Entire house except garage available for your use
neighborhood_overview: The country view from our deck and our quiet neighborhood will make you feel rested and relaxed after full days of exploring.
host_about: Wherever I travel I want to feel at home - be a local - live like I've always been there! And if you ever have a chance to stay with us - we have you have a similar experience.

name: Monthly Downtown Salem Loft Apt. by Salemstays.com
description:
1,100 sq ft Downtown Loft apartment in the heart of the City of Salem Oregon. This brand new apartment has high ceilings and aerial city views. Everything turned out lovely, from the quartz countertops to the carpets. You have every amenity and are in the center of the City. 1/2 block from the Willamette River front park, all the cool restaurants and bars/coffee shops. You will want for nothing, it is all at your fingertips. Come stay downtown and enjoy some City Living with all the convenience

The space
I am so excited to share this new listing and brand new apartment. Built in the heart of the city where everyone wants to stay and play. 2 bedrooms both with queen size beds, each room is has its own sink and vanity. Full size washer and dryer and all gas appliances. AC, cable TV and internet all included. If you walk a 1/2 block west you will end up at the downtown Salem Willamette River front park where you can walk along the river, do yoga in the park, attend
neighborhood_overview:
Neighborhood
This loft is located 4 city blocks from Oregon State Capitol. 5 city blocks from Willamette University. 2 blocks from Salem Convention Center. 1 block from Riverfront park and Willamette River. Front door opens to downtown boutique shops and restaurants. Full service mall, Salem Center, with 65 National and local brands stores. There is a Cinema with 7 theaters that offers food and alcohol at your theater seat. We are 10 blocks from Salem Hospital and birthing center. We are 11 blocks from historical Bush Park, gardens and art barn next to Deepwood historical mansion.
Parks
Riverfront Park is a 23-acre park located in downtown Salem along the Willamette River and connects to Wallace Marine Park which has 114.45 acres. It is the home of one of the best sports facilities in the Northwest and has miles of walking, jogging and biking paths and is also a haven for bird watchers.
host_about: You can reach me at Salemstays

name: Upstairs 2 Bed 1 Bath Condo with Creek View!
description:
With the creek view, you feel like you are camping but with the convenience of being in the City Center. 2nd floor unit with 1 set of stairs to access the unit. Private unit at end of building (only one neighbor)

You will have one assigned, covered parking spot in the carport and a second spot may be available upon request (depending on availability.)

The space
Over 1000 SF! Sunny and bright two bedrooms, large bathroom, full kitchen, large living room, Creekside condo just blocks from downtown Salem. Wonderful view of historic Mill Creek and large balcony overlooking the creek. Reserved parking . Three blocks from Salem Center Mall, five blocks from State Capital and six from Willamette University. This is in an apartment building, it is on the second floor so you will have a neighbor below and to the side of you. You will hear other people which is part of life when sharing walls. If that is not something you want please look for a home that would be
neighborhood_overview:
You are in the downtown area and though it is very safe (the new police station is being built only 4 blocks away), this is a metro area and there are two homeless support facilities in the downtown area so you will see the people they support. We have never had any issues or any of our guests, but it is a part of life in many cities and you should be aware of it, if this will be a concern for you we recommend you look for a property outside of the downtown area.

This is a mid century modern building that was built in the 1964, it is VERY well maintained and well built with unique stone aggregate siding. It is not a new building but it is well built with large units and an amazing location right on the creek. All units have been updated, but please be aware of the age of the building as some people have commented it was older. It has a lot of character that you do not get in a modern building.

You are 6 blocks (10 minutes) from the state capital and if you go up 1
host_about: Love to travel and spend time with my family and our dog!  Grew up in Oregon and loved coming back after college.

name: Cozy Boho Cottage close to downtown and hospital
description:
Beautiful boho cottage close to downtown restaurants, parks and Salem hospitals. Perfect for traveling nurses or couples/singles traveling for work who need a longer-term home away from home. Ideal for a fun change of scenery if you are working remotely.

The space
The house is laid out with half the house an open-plan kitchen and dining room. The other half of the house is divided into three rooms. We have set these up as the main bedroom with a queen bed, a living room with chairs/sofa and TV, and an office/2nd bedroom with desk and twin bed currently set up as a daybed. The washer and dryer are on site.

The TV is internet-connected only. Amazon video is included. Any other streaming service will need guests to log in to their personal accounts. There is an HDMI cord connected to the TV to allow for easier connectivity to guests' laptops.

Nestled in a historic district.
1 mile from Salem Hospital and downtown Salem, 3 blocks from grocery store.

1 bed/1 bath unit located in the upstairs unit.
Enjoy a fully equipped kitchen, a bright, comfy living room with Wifi, smart TV, dedicated work space, two bedrooms and a shared washer/dryer.

Great location for walks and close to safe outdoor activities.

name: The Iris Room
description:
1926 artist's cottage, two blocks from historic Bush Park. Queen bed in downstairs room, private bathroom. Shared living room, dining room, kitchen, spacious back yard. Electric vehicle charger, off street parking available by discussion. Short-term rental License #22-102644-LI Please have your own profile when you book, and do not book a reservation for anyone else. It will be refused. Check-in before 10pm.

The space
Beauty, comfort, and creativity are important to me, and what I aim to share with others. Wood floors, tall ceilings, natural light, and simple furnishings provide a relaxing atmosphere. The walls are hung with my paintings and fabric art. I love the outdoors as much as the indoors, and Bush Park is two blocks away. Walk along Pringle Creek under the tall firs, then come back and work in private, or join me in the living room for conversation or a good book.

Guest access
Cozy living room with many comfortable places to sit by
neighborhood_overview: Small bungalows and quiet streets make for an interesting morning walk, or you can go two blocks north into Bush Park. There you will be in tall firs, along Pringle Creek, with both gravel walkways and paved sidewalks. The neighborhood is quiet, although Berry St sees its share of cars coming and going into Salem, just a mile away. Sirens are in the distance, since the hospital is a half-mile, but they are not loud. I occasionally hear the train whistle, which I enjoy.
host_about: I moved to Salem, Oregon in 2004 and love being close to our parks, the coast, and the mountains. I teach art at the community college. I love painting, reading, sewing and Nature. I've been a member of AirBnB since 2013, and enjoy meeting new people and visiting new places. I look forward to hosting you!

Bring your family for an amazing get away! Huge bedrooms. 2.5 bathroom. Great place for traveling medical staff! There are provided games and and an amazing back yard with propane skillet! Fun for kids and family. Kids room to get kids to have a great indoor experience as well. Magical kitchen newly renovated to cook, bake, and celebrate with those close to you!

This a great place for travelers to share or have a retreat or smaller events. All events needs to be discussed and approved.

The space
There is a large kitchen and living area. A more formal dinning space and a dinettes with window seal benches. There is a beautiful master with large soaking tub and his and her sinks and private shower and toilet. The 3 bedrooms upstairs are all different. A large kid room with a solid wood bunk. The full sized top has a wooden stair and a queen sized bottom bunk. There is also a crib in there. The second bedroom has a twin bed and wooden dresser. The bonus ro
neighborhood_overview: The house is a few minutes from I-5, Keizer station and IN and OUT burger is about 10 min away. Willamette town center is also about 10 min away. Salem Hospital is 15 minutes away. Portland is about 45 minutes away as well.

description:
Enjoy the luxurious Emerald room on the second floor of an absolutely gorgeous fully renovated historic home. Located centrally in the beautiful Court Chemeketa historic district, this home has quick access to most anywhere in Salem. It's a short walk or bike ride to downtown, state offices, and hospitals.

The entire house is stylish, welcoming, and free to use. It was fully renovated, remodeled, and furnished in 2021. Kick back, relax, and enjoy easy living! Or work from home in luxury!

This stylish private room includes all amenities, including full bed, luxury linens, pillows, nightstands, accent table, lamps, lounge chair, powered sit-stand glass desk, ergonomic desk chair, and more. name: Newly remodeled modern home in South Salem
description:
Enjoy this unattached home near restaurants and grocery stores in South Salem. This is a two bedroom rental and one full bathroom house. Two bedrooms are available to rent. The third bedroom is locked and used as storage. This home is on our property for work and is a shared parking space with customers.
The kitchen is stocked with everything you need to make a meal, bake or close restaurants if you want takeout.

The space
This house is in the parking lot of our work office. It’s a separate house not attached to any other buildings. The only shared space is the parking spaces. We ask that you park one car Monday through Wednesday in the parking lot. Outside of those days you can park in any of the spots.

The home has a keyless entry and you will get a code prior to your stay. The home is three bedrooms but two of the bedrooms are locked for storage.

If you stay for an extended period of time we may need access to the garage or storage
neighborhood_overview: This home is between residential and commercial space. Behind the home is many residential houses and families. In front of the home is shopping, restaurants and quick access to town.
host_about: Caleb and I own a small dental office in Salem and remodeled the separated home on the property. We have used the space for classes and workshops for dentists that Caleb teaches. We are new to hosting and want your experiences to be comfortable. Help us make this space great for everyone.

Newly remodeled with lots of unique family heirlooms. You have total privacy in my large guest suite located in the upper part of my split level house. Private Entrance. Guest access
The entire property is accessible besides the garage temporarily. We plan to build a game room in garage in future developments.

name: The 3 Oaks @ 1123 17th SE Salem  by Salemstays.com
description:
The three Oaks duplex home at 1123 17th St. Salem, OR 97301. Come enjoy are comfortable, stylish, centrally located property which is just walking minutes away from the State Capitol, Willamette University or Downtown Salem Historic District bosting all its history and charm. This location you're very close to everything with easy jump on and off 1-5 freeway access. Just finished fully remodeled, everything is completely brand new inside with smart style and every amenity you could ever imagine.

The space
Harken back to 1958, this historic property was built by the US Government to house officers after WWII. Today it is fully remodelled showing off the orginial, refinished oak hardwood floors, large picutre window and large kitchen and laundry room. The recent renovation added other luxury items like heated tile floors in the kitchen and bathrooms, keep your toes toasty warm for winter. The bathrrom has a Toto Washlet toilet with heated seat and washing feature

name: Modern and bright Salem townhome getaway w/ views
description:
Welcome to the heart of Oregon and wine county!
Conveniently located close to I5 to make your travels easy, this townhome feels luxurious while also having a cozy feel, perfect for a quick getaway or a longer term stay.

Whether you want to take in the views, kick back on the couch, or explore the surrounding area, this townhome offers a little bit for everyone.

This is a townhome and has shared walls, so please be aware and courteous of that.

The space
BEDROOMS
- Two private bedrooms and one den. (Please note: the den does not have a door)
- The den has an 8 inch queen mattress and a curtain for privacy. It also has a desk.
- Linens and cozy comforters
- Cooling pillows
- Queen beds with 10 inch hybrid beds (spring/memory foam).

LIVING ROOM
- Open floor plan between kitchen and living space
- Smart 65" TV with ROKU and guest login
- High speed internet
- Large comfortable couch
neighborhood_overview:
This is a neighborhood with other townhomes and homes around. It is in the city and will have some road/traffic noise.
it is close to shopping and dining and right off a main street!

name: Alice
description:
Enter Wonderland. Travel through the looking glass vortex to this unique artistically designed space full of whimsy. The canopy bed will have you sleeping like the Queen of Hearts, while the locally created mural art in the Cheshire Room gives you a perfect backdrop as a reading nook.
The Eat Me/Drink Me snacks will await your arrival. Will you be able to fit through the tiny mouse doors to find even more adventure?
Enjoy the mirrors on the ceiling while lounging on the fainting couch.

The space
The full kitchen will allow you to create a full Tea Party experience, to dine at the large Mad Hatter’s table.
The small bathroom is covered in the eucalyptus vines of Alice’s garden.

Outside, dine in the rose garden under the solar lights.

There is a washer and dryer in the building, that takes coin, or an app to use.

This Victorian home was built in the year 1900. It has been separated into four completely separate apart
neighborhood_overview:
Walking distance to our favorite breakfast spots: Taproot at the Old Mill, or Word of Mouth.

Ask for other recommendations!!
host_about:
Hi! I’m a fitness professional and mom, with a love for travel, adventure, and the finer things in life.
My partner and I, (recently engaged!!) have several properties in the area, and are happy to host you!
I’m into health, great food, and cultural events. Need to know the hottest restaurants, or about the happening music scene? I’m your gal.

name: Soleil
description:
This darling one-bedroom apartment is situated at the top of of a 1900s build, historical home.
It’s breezy and light boho decor is accompanied by an indoor light up swing hammock, a queen sized memory foam bed, and a full kitchen stocked with essentials.
This apartment has gorgeous natural light, or you can lounge at the bistro table on the front porch, or the community garden out back.

Less than one mile to Salem Health Center, Willamette University, and the Capital Building.

The space
There are four private apartments in this historical building, each with its own entry. No interaction with the other tenants.

This is a cozy space- 450 sq feet. Perfect for a single person, or a romantic couple.
This apartment has a queen sized memory foam bed, a hanging LED lit swing hammock, a bathroom with shower (no tub,) a full kitchen with cooking utensils and equipment, and a full set of dishes, and a dining area with seating for two.

name: Cozy Creek Cottage with lush backyard.
description:
Adorable cottage overlooking Mill Creek near downtown Salem. Two spacious bedrooms with views of the creek. Enjoy your morning coffee on the upper deck and BBQ later on the lower deck. There is a hammock and a firepit for relaxation and entertainment. Close to Willamette University, Hospitals, The Capitol, State buildings and Shopping. Air mattress and crib available upon request. Remodeled kitchen with all the amenities to cook a full meal. Only an Hour drive to the coast or the mountains.

The space
Large living room with electric reclining sectional that is light and bright with a big TV. Huge master with a comfortable chair and 2 closets. It overlooks the backyard and creek through a big picture window. Cute bathroom with tub/shower and pedestal sink. Second bedroom also has a view and 2 vintage metal twin beds. There is a converter pad in the closet to make the twins into a king for couples. Gorgeous kitchen with complimentary snack basket, that has generous
neighborhood_overview: Cute little side street of the main road with several historic age homes.

I love to travel and have been to many places with many yet to experience. I went most recently to Egypt.  I am a real estate agent by trade and own and invest homes for fun as well.

The cozy studio apartment situated inside the 120+ year old house features a private entry, propane heat stove, king bed, full kitchen, laundry, & Wi-Fi. 10 min drive to vibrant historic downtown, as well as many nearby wineries, farms, & brew pubs. With paths to explore, a small pond, & various fruit trees, there is no shortage of magic here.

The space
The home is clean and well-maintained with comfortable furnishings. The 650sq ft studio guest suite comes with a king bed, free live TV, heat, a full kitchen with coffee maker and microwave, free shared laundry, and free parking.

Enjoy the luxury of custom design while staying at this mid-century home. Wrapped in wood, flooded with light, with an abundance of houseplants, organic mattresses, linen sheets, and a fully furnished kitchen.

You can relax in style while enjoying all the comforts of home, plus the extras of a record player, retro video games, washer/dryer, and a two-car garage to park out of the weather.

This south Salem abode is within walking distance to quality grocery stores, restaurants, and coffeeshops.

The space
Unique three-tier home design, cozy urban cabin vibe. 14' ceilings, 10' south-facing windows with made-to-order linen curtains, natural wood inside and out. Remarkable amount of natural light, with noteworthly light fixtures for after dark.

Double door entryway with coat closet accessible from short walkway and interior garage door. Staircase leads to open concept living room, with a second, shorter stairway to the kitchen/dining a

I love interior design, investing in real estate, and helping others get more money for their houses when they sell.

I live in Salem, OR with my beautiful young family of 1 husband, 3 kiddos, and 9 chickens.

Cozy one bedroom, full size dining table and spacious living room. Laundry and closet area attached to the full size bathroom. name: Happy Camper - Tiny living w/simple breakfast! ☕️
description:
Enjoy the simple life with comforts of home while staying in The Happy Camper! Located in a quiet neighborhood and only a 10minute walk to Sunset Park, where you can access the Willamette River.

The space
The Happy Camper is tucked away in the front of our property.

Guest access
Enjoy the camper, front patio set-up, and single car parking space all to yourself. You may see us about the surrounding yard maintaining the grounds.

Other things to note
The Happy Camper is fully connected to a continuous supply of city electricity and incoming city freshwater. However, the outgoing sewer feeds into tanks that need to be emptied regularly, by host, on-site.

Guests are REQUIRED to check the level of black & grey tanks DAILY (sensor panel located on kitchen wall) and message host with status accordingly.

Failure to comply with daily tank status will result in immediate removal of all guests from property
neighborhood_overview:
Nearby Wallace House Park has a playground, exercise area, and seasonal trail leading to the river.

Continue about half mile further to locate a Little Free Library on the way to Sunset Park, where there is more accessible river access.

name: Monthly Downtown Salem Loft Apt. by Salemstays.com
description:
1,100 sq ft Downtown loft apartment in the heart of the City of Salem Oregon. This brand new apartment has high ceilings and aerial city views. Everything turned out lovely, from the quartz countertops to the carpets. You have every amenity and are in the center of the City. 1/2 block from the Willamette Riverfront park, all the cool restaurants, and bars/coffee shops. You will want for nothing, it is all at your fingertips. Come stay downtown and enjoy some City Living with all the convenience.

The space
I am so excited to share this new listing and brand new apartment. Built in the heart of the city where everyone wants to stay and play. 2 bedrooms one with a king-size bed and a queen, each room has its own sink and vanity. Full-size washer and dryer and all gas appliances. AC, cable TV, and internet are all included. If you walk a 1/2 block west you will end up at the downtown Salem Willamette Riverfront park where you can walk along the river, do yoga in the
neighborhood_overview:
Neighborhood
This loft is located 4 city blocks from Oregon State Capitol. 5 city blocks from Willamette University. 2 blocks from Salem Convention Center. 1 block from Riverfront park and Willamette River. Front door opens to downtown boutique shops and restaurants. Full service mall, Salem Center, with 65 National and local brands stores. There is a Cinema with 7 theaters that offers food and alcohol at your theater seat. We are 10 blocks from Salem Hospital and birthing center. We are 11 blocks from historical Bush Park, gardens and art barn next to Deepwood historical mansion.
Parks
Riverfront Park is a 23-acre park located in downtown Salem along the Willamette River and connects to Wallace Marine Park which has 114.45 acres. It is the home of one of the best sports facilities in the Northwest and has miles of walking, jogging and biking paths and is also a haven for bird watchers.

Everything you need at your fingertips. Enjoy a great experience in our RV, with super slide outs for added spacious comfort amidst all the beauty here in the PNW. name: Suede
description:
Imagine a gentleman sitting at a table, working on his laptop. His laptop has a suede binding to it, and it’s accompanying briefcase is a vintage sepia toned enclosure which looks as though it has recently been hand-brushed. His fedora is perched intentionally on the seat next to him, and his pocket square and sibling pocket watch are a display of elegance.

The space
His shoes are expertly shined, and his style catches your eye because it is both sophisticated and understated. He isn’t creating a show for attention, as he never looks up from his work; he simply is the epitome of elegance and style.

This apartment has been designed with this gentleman in mind. Where would a traveling professional like himself like to stay, without the noise of a hotel room? What would his choice color palate be, and which decor would he want on the walls? The answers we came up with, are what you will find in Suede; a small studio apartment with style.

This

This is a neighborhood with a mix of Victorian homes and modern dwellings. The neighbors are all very quiet.

One mile to downtown.

Antique 1905 home recently renovated with unique artistic style of the owners, chainsaw artists of Oregon 3D Art and Chainsaw Sculptures.
